Ten Horror Films You Should Watch This Halloween

Lauren McNeilage prepares us for the Halloween season by choosing ten films to scare us into the mood.

TV Review: American Horror Story: Hotel - Episode 3: 'Mommy'

Angela Bassett brings some much needed life to an otherwise gloomy episode of American Horror Story, says Lauren McNeilage

Review: Suffragette

The much anticipated film about the Suffragette movement well documents the struggles women faced in acquiring the vote in Britain, whilst also serving as a reminder for how the fight must continue on a global scale in 2015, says Kate Barlow

TV Review: Lewis - Series 9 Episode 3: 'Magnum Opus' Part One

Some predictable moments and plot points that seem very similar make this episode of Lewis feel somewhat disappointing, says Katy Sandalls

TV Review: The Walking Dead - Series 6 Episode 2: 'JSS'

The Wolves are in the walls and Alexandria is in for its first encounter with the chaotic outside world. Liam Dooley reviews

TV Review: Doctor Who - Series 9 Episode 5: 'The Girl Who Died'

With a story-line that is not too complex, this episode about Vikings is a refreshing change to the usual style of Doctor Who, says Ida Sjoberg

TV Review: Lewis - Series 9 Episode 2: 'One for Sorrow' Part Two

An unpredictable plot and a compelling side story allowed for a thoroughly entertaining episode of Lewis, says Katy Sandalls

TV Review: Homeland - Series Five Episode One: 'Separation Anxiety'

By James Bithell

Jack Alden reviews the season premiere of Homeland as it attempts to reinvent itself, yet again, at the start of its fifth season, like its protagonist Carrie Mathison

Review: Crimson Peak

Blood-soaked and beautiful, Crimson Peak is part Hitchcockian thriller, part gothic romance, and entirely brilliant, says Lauren McNeilage

TV Review: American Horror Story: Hotel - Episode 2: 'Chutes and Ladders'

Despite a chilling turn by Evan Peters, this season is still frustratingly lacking in scares, says Lauren McNeilage

TV Review: The Walking Dead Series 6 Episode 1: 'First Time Again'

The Walking Dead returns with a zombie-filled, action-packed and visually stunning first episode, says Liam Dooley

Celebrity Status, the Refugee Crisis and Douglas Booth

After a brief encounter with Douglas Booth at Leeds train station, Afreen Hussain goes on to explore his celebrity status and how he has used this platform to support worthwhile causes

With a new spin-off of Doctor Who announced for 2016, Liam Dooley takes a look at what it is about this franchise that allows for so many spin-off shows
